texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Emojis brighten up any message or document. They also serve as excellent methods for testing whether your application handles strings appropriately.  (This can be a lot of fun.)  🤭
texts.text: Emojis brighten up any message or document. They also serve as excellent methods for testing whether your application handles strings appropriately.  (This can be a lot of fun.)  🤭

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I constantly obsess with efficiency and shortening the time and effort required to get my work done. I noticed that I could type short text emoticons like  :) and  ;)  so much faster than I could use emojis. This simply would not do. 😉
texts.text: I constantly obsess with efficiency and shortening the time and effort required to get my work done. I noticed that I could type short text emoticons like  :) and  ;)  so much faster than I could use emojis. This simply would not do. 😉

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: First attempts
texts.text: First attempts

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Emoji Copy  was my first try at getting the emojis I needed quickly. The site also offers a native emoji mode which allows you to see if your system is handling emojis correctly. The site loads quickly and the search finds emojis in a flash, but it was annoying to open a browser tab just to find an emoji. 🤦🏻‍♂️
texts.text: Emoji Copy  was my first try at getting the emojis I needed quickly. The site also offers a native emoji mode which allows you to see if your system is handling emojis correctly. The site loads quickly and the search finds emojis in a flash, but it was annoying to open a browser tab just to find an emoji. 🤦🏻‍♂️

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The GNOME Extension called  Emoji Selector  made the selection process faster, but I moved from GNOME to i3 and lost my GNOME extensions. 🤷🏻‍♂️
texts.text: The GNOME Extension called  Emoji Selector  made the selection process faster, but I moved from GNOME to i3 and lost my GNOME extensions. 🤷🏻‍♂️

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Other methods, such as the  Emoji input method  and the  ibus-typing-booster , also worked, but I knew there had to be something more efficient than those. 🤔
texts.text: Other methods, such as the  Emoji input method  and the  ibus-typing-booster , also worked, but I knew there had to be something more efficient than those. 🤔

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Enter rofimoji
texts.text: Enter rofimoji

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The  rofi  launcher quickly become part of my core workflow in i3 (replacing dmenu ) and I was pleasantly surprised to find  rofimoji  in GitHub. 🤗
texts.text: The  rofi  launcher quickly become part of my core workflow in i3 (replacing dmenu ) and I was pleasantly surprised to find  rofimoji  in GitHub. 🤗

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The rofimoji launcher follows in rofi's footsteps and gives you quick access to emojis. Using rofimoji is easy:
texts.text: The rofimoji launcher follows in rofi's footsteps and gives you quick access to emojis. Using rofimoji is easy:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Bind a key combination to run
texts.text: Bind a key combination to run

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Type in a search term to find the perfect emoji
texts.text: Type in a search term to find the perfect emoji

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Press enter to input it directly in the active window or shift+enter to copy
texts.text: Press enter to input it directly in the active window or shift+enter to copy

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Depending on the application you're using, you might need to mess around with roflmoji's
texts.text: Depending on the application you're using, you might need to mess around with roflmoji's

texts.label: code
texts.orig: --action
texts.text: --action

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: parameter. Some applications will take the emoji directly as if you typed it from a keyboard, but most of the ones I use seem to like a copy/paste method via the clipboard. 📋
texts.text: parameter. Some applications will take the emoji directly as if you typed it from a keyboard, but most of the ones I use seem to like a copy/paste method via the clipboard. 📋

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I use the
texts.text: I use the

texts.label: code
texts.orig: --action clipboard
texts.text: --action clipboard

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: parameter and it works well across browsers and terminals. Here's the line from the i3 configuration file:
texts.text: parameter and it works well across browsers and terminals. Here's the line from the i3 configuration file:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: bindsym $mod+e exec --no-startup-id rofimoji --skin-tone light --action clipboard --rofi-args='-theme solarized -font "hack 12" -width 800'
texts.text: bindsym $mod+e exec --no-startup-id rofimoji --skin-tone light --action clipboard --rofi-args='-theme solarized -font "hack 12" -width 800'

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: RPMs for Fedora, CentOS, and RHEL
texts.text: RPMs for Fedora, CentOS, and RHEL

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: At the moment, rofimoji is not packaged for Fedora, CentOS, or Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL). However, you can install it from my  COPR packages repository :
texts.text: At the moment, rofimoji is not packaged for Fedora, CentOS, or Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL). However, you can install it from my  COPR packages repository :

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
sudo dnf copr enable mhayden/packages
sudo dnf install python3-rofimoji
texts.text:
sudo dnf copr enable mhayden/packages
sudo dnf install python3-rofimoji

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Enjoy! 🍰
texts.text: Enjoy! 🍰

texts.label: paragraph
